titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1827 Oct. 29 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1827 Oct. 29
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1824 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Monday October 29, 1827 session of court, during which a series of civil cases were heard. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: Monday 29th
div1.p: Court convened agreeable to adjournment, Present

James Foster
vs
The Peacock Execr of Jesse Vann Decd
Recovery of Stolen Cattle
The Court find for the Plaintiff sixteen dollars

Monday 29 October 1827 James Foreman
vs
Necootiah
Debt on Note
Judgement for the plaintiff for Forty dollars 29th Oct. 1827

Fox Taylor
vs
Caty McEntosh
Debt
Judgmt. in favour of the plaintiff for two dollars & 40 Cents which is the cost of appeal-

Recd. of the defendant two dollars & forty Cents in full of the appeal in the above Case.
John MartinN.T.

Gidian Childers
vs
John Walker Sr.
debt
Judgment against the plaintiff

Recd. the above cost of sixty Cents.
John Martin N.T.

Thigh Walker
vs
Robert Fields
Debt
The Court find the plaintiff fifty seven bushels of Corn or ninteen dollars
The per Cent on appeal, Cost of appeal $1.14
Recd. the above Cost of one dollar & 14 cts. John Martin N.T.
Court is adjourned untill tomorrow 9 Oclock Execution Issued on 22 Decr 1832
